title: Vivo Y29 5G launched in India at Rs.13999- Check out specs, features, and more - Hindustan Times
summary:
Vivo Y29 5G launched with MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor and 5500mAh battery

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Vivo has launched its new affordable Y-series smartphone, the Vivo Y29 5G in India at a starting price of just Rs.13999. The smartphone features a slimmer profile and attractive design, making it stand out. It packs a powerful processor for day-to-day tasks.

Key Points

  • Price starts at Rs.13999 for 4GB+128GB storage.
  • Features a 6.68-inch LCD display with 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Packed with MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor and up to 8GB RAM.
  • Offers 5500mAh battery with 44W fast charging and impressive playback time.
  • Available in Glacier Blue, Titanium Gold, and Diamond Black colors.
“The smartphone offers several AI-powered camera features such as AI Night Mode and AI Photo Enhance.”

The Vivo Y29 5G is an appealing choice for budget-conscious consumers looking for feature-rich smartphones.

title: UltraTech buys 8.69% stake from Star Cement promoter group for ₹851 crore - CNBCTV18
summary:
UltraTech buys 8.69% stake from Star Cement promoter group for ₹851 crore

Date: Dec 27, 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

In a notable move in the cement industry, UltraTech Cement Ltd. has acquired an 8.69% stake in Star Cement Ltd. from its promoter group for ₹851 crore.

  • UltraTech acquired the shares at ₹235 per share.
  • This stake is a non-controlling minority stake in Star Cement.
  • Star Cement, based in Meghalaya, reported a turnover of ₹2,910 crore in FY 2024.
  • UltraTech recently also acquired a 32.72% stake in India Cements, making it a subsidiary.
  • Star Cement boasts a 7.7 MTPA grinding capacity and a 26.5% market share in the north-eastern market.
  • The company is planning a ₹380 crore capex for the second half of FY 2024.
“The blocks are estimated to have geological limestone reserves of 63.9 million tonnes.”

This acquisition indicates UltraTech's ongoing strategy of consolidation in the cement sector.
newTitle: UltraTech Acquires 8.69% Stake in Star Cement for ₹851 Crore

IND vs AUS: Steve Smith's majestic innings ends in bizarre fashion at the MCG - Watch - The Times of India
summary:
IND vs AUS: Steve Smith's majestic innings ends in bizarre fashion at the MCG - Watch

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Steve Smith had an eventful day during the fourth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. He scored 140 runs, becoming the most successful century-maker against India in Test cricket history.

  • Smith scored 140 runs off 197 balls, achieving his 34th Test century.
  • This innings made him the joint seventh-highest century-maker in Test cricket history.
  • He is now Australia's second-highest century-maker with 41 centuries, trailing Ricky Ponting.
  • Smith's innings ended in a bizarre manner when he accidentally hit the ball onto his back leg, dislodging a bail.
  • Despite the unusual dismissal, he left the field to a standing ovation from the crowd.
“His audacious attempt at a big shot highlighted his intent.”

In conclusion, Steve Smith's remarkable performance at the MCG further cements his legacy as one of cricket's modern greats.
newTitle: Steve Smith's Unusual Dismissal After Stellar Innings at MCG

title: Tata Motors shares get an upgrade after a 37% drop from their peak on better risk-reward - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tata Motors Shares Upgraded After 37% Drop Amid Positive Risk-Reward Outlook

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm DAM Capital has upgraded Tata Motors' rating from "neutral" to "buy" following a significant price drop, citing an improved risk-reward scenario.

  • Price target raised to ₹870, indicating an 18% potential upside.
  • Current shares down nearly 40% from the recent peak of ₹1,170.
  • Expected recovery in the auto sector by financial year 2026.
  • Jaguar Land Rover's expected growth at a CAGR of 6.5% over 2025-2027.
  • Among 36 analysts, 22 maintain a "buy" rating on the stock.
  • Shares closed at ₹741.5, down 5% in 2024 so far.
"The stock was the best Nifty 50 performer in 2023 and the only index stock that had doubled during the calendar year."

The upgrade reflects a cautious optimism amidst near-term challenges, suggesting a potential turnaround for Tata Motors in the coming quarters.
newTitle: Tata Motors Shares Upgraded After 37% Drop Amid Positive Risk-Reward Outlook

title: Manmohan Singh death: Are banks, schools closed today (December 27)? Check details - Hindustan Times
summary:
Manmohan Singh Death: Impact on Schools and Banks in India

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh passed away at the age of 92. The Union government declared seven days of mourning, but so far, only Karnataka has officially declared a holiday for schools and colleges.

  • The Union Cabinet will meet on December 27 to pay tribute to Manmohan Singh.
  • National Flag will be at half-mast with no official entertainment during the mourning period.
  • No official announcement yet on bank closures on December 27; digital banking services will remain operational.
  • Karnataka has declared a holiday for schools and colleges.
  • Awaiting announcements from other states regarding educational institutions.
“History will be kinder to me than the media.” - Manmohan Singh

This event marks a significant moment in Indian history, as it affects political rituals and public observance nationwide.
newTitle: Manmohan Singh Death: Impact on Schools and Banks in India

Ricky Ponting blasts ICC for letting Virat Kohli go easily for Sam Konstas act; Gavaskar calls it ‘slap on the wrist’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ricky Ponting blasts ICC for letting Virat Kohli go easily for Sam Konstas act; Gavaskar calls it ‘slap on the wrist’

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Ricky Ponting has openly criticized the ICC for what he perceives to be a lenient punishment for Virat Kohli after a physical altercation during a Boxing Day Test.

  • Ponting argues that Kohli's 20% match fee fine is insufficient given the seriousness of the incident.
  • Kohli was sanctioned for a shoulder bump against debutant Sam Konstas, classified as a Level 1 offence.
  • Legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar also supports the view that the penalty is inadequate, calling it a ‘slap on the wrist’.
  • Ponting emphasizes Kohli's role as a role model and believes stricter consequences are warranted.
  • The incident raises concerns over the message sent to younger players regarding acceptable conduct.
“That’s a slap on the wrist. All these players are highly paid professionals. Any fines will have to be a deterrent.” – Sunil Gavaskar

The opinions expressed highlight the need for the ICC to enforce stronger disciplinary measures to maintain standards in professional cricket.
newTitle: Ricky Ponting criticizes ICC for lenient punishment on Virat Kohli

title: WHO chief Tedros narrowly escapes bombardment at Yemen's Sanaa airport - Hindustan Times
summary:
WHO Chief Tedros Survives Bombardment at Yemen's Sanaa Airport

Date: Dec 27, 2024 06:48 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus narrowly escaped an aerial bombardment at Sanaa International Airport in Yemen, which resulted in the deaths of at least two individuals.

  • Tedros and colleagues were about to board a flight when the attack occurred.
  • One crew member was injured during the incident.
  • UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres condemned the attack and called for respect for international law.
  • Airstrikes by the Israeli Air Force targeted Houthi military infrastructure in Yemen, including the airport.
“Our mission to negotiate the release of UN staff detainees and to assess the health and humanitarian situation in Yemen concluded today… At least two people were reported killed at the airport.” - Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus

This tragic event highlights the precarious situation in Yemen, where conflict continues to pose significant threats to civilians and humanitarian missions.
newTitle: WHO Chief Tedros Survives Bombardment at Yemen's Sanaa Airport

title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu reignites 70-hour work week debate, asks should we work to demographic suicide? His answer is... | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu reignites 70-hour work week debate, asks should we work to demographic suicide? His answer is...

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Live Mint

In a recent post, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revisited the contentious 70-hour work week debate, questioning its necessity for economic development and the impact of such work culture on demographics.

The rationale behind the 70 hour work week is "it is necessary for economic development". If you look at East Asia - Japan, South Korea, Taiwan and China have all developed through extreme hard work, often imposing punitive levels of work on their own people.

Key Points:

  • Vembu argues that extreme work hours may not be necessary for economic growth.
  • He points out low birth rates in East Asian countries that prioritize hard work.
  • Questions the viability of success at the expense of personal well-being.
  • Calls for a balance between hard work and personal life.
newTitle: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu Challenges the 70-Hour Work Week Debate

title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy | Indian players wear black armband in memory of late Manmohan Singh - The Hindu
summary:
Indian men’s and women’s cricket teams wear black armbands in memory of Manmohan Singh

Published on - December 27, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The Indian men’s and women’s cricket teams sported black armbands in their respective matches on Friday to honour former prime minister Manmohan Singh, who died in New Delhi.

  • Manmohan Singh, former prime minister from 2004 to 2014, passed away at the age of 92 due to age-related ailments.
  • The men’s team is playing the Boxing Day Test against Australia in Melbourne.
  • The women’s team is facing West Indies in Vadodara.
  • The BCCI confirmed the teams are wearing black armbands as a mark of respect.
  • Manmohan Singh was known for his economic reforms in 1991 that transformed India's economy.
“The Indian team is wearing black arm bands as a mark of respect in the memory of former PM Dr Manmohan Singh, who passed away,” the BCCI said in a statement.

This gesture by India’s cricket teams highlights the impact of Manmohan Singh's legacy on both the nation and its economy.
newTitle: Indian Cricket Teams Pay Tribute to Manmohan Singh

title: 'Baby John' box office collection Day 2: Varun Dhawan starrer crashes with Rs 4.5 crore collection; 'Push - TOI Etimes
The Hindu Morning Digest, December 27, 2024 - The Hindu
summary:
Manmohan Singh, gentleman politician who opened up India’s economy in 1991, passes away

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh passed away late on Thursday, December 26, 2024, at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences. He was 92 years old and had recently retired as a member of the Rajya Sabha.

  • Singh represented Assam in the Upper House for six terms since 1991.
  • The Finance Ministry stated that the central bank's monetary policy stance may have contributed to a slowdown in demand.
  • The BJP received ₹2,604 crore in donations in 2023-24, which is nine times more than the Congress's ₹281 crore.
  • China's Defence Ministry confirmed the comprehensive implementation of an agreement to resolve the Ladakh standoff.
  • VHP leader commented that many temple-mosque disputes could have been avoided if Hindus had Mathura and Kashi.
  • Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticized PM Modi for not acknowledging insulting remarks made about Dr. Ambedkar.
  • The Election Commission reported over 10.58 lakh votes were not counted or rejected in the recent Lok Sabha election.
  • Bapsi Sidhwa, a renowned novelist, passed away at the age of 86 in Houston, U.S.
  • A PIL was filed in the Supreme Court to abolish the TDS system for being arbitrary and a violation of rights.
  • A Delhi tutor was arrested for inciting protests by civil service aspirants in Patna.
  • Five Palestinian journalists were killed in an Israeli strike in Gaza.
  • North India continues to experience severe cold wave conditions, with no snow in popular tourist destinations.
  • Intermittent rains are expected in parts of northern Tamil Nadu due to a weakened weather system over the Bay of Bengal.
  • Indian women’s cricket team aims for a clean sweep against West Indies in the final ODI.

Published - December 27, 2024 06:13 am IST
newTitle: Manmohan Singh, a Gentleman's Politician, Passes Away
